{{merge|List of rampage killers (school massacres)|discuss=Talk:List of school massacres by death toll#Proposed merge with List of rampage killers (school massacres)|date=February 2018}} {{pp-pc1|expiry=02:36, October 25, 2018|small=yes}} {{Use mdy dates|date=November 2017}} {{Use American English|date=November 2017}} This list of '''school massacres by death toll''' contains those cases that occurred at [[kindergarten]]s, [[school]]s and [[University|universities]], as well as their affiliated buildings. If the perpetrator was a member of the school staff and the victims primarily his colleagues the case is not included here but added to the [[List of rampage killers: Workplace killings|list of workplace killings]]. School [[massacre]]s are counted as incidents involving at least two deaths, excluding the potential death of the perpetrator. 37932412.title: List of school shootings in the United States

revisions.*:
{{pp-protected|reason=vandalism/disruptive editing|expiry=22:59, May 13, 2018|small=yes}}
{{Expand list|date=June 2017}}

{{Broader|Gun violence in the United States}}

{{Use mdy dates|date=November 2017}}
{{Use American English|date=November 2017}}

This article lists in chronology and provides additional details of incidents in which a firearm was discharged at a school infrastructure or campus in the United States, including incidents of shootings on a [[school bus]]. This list contains [[school shooting]] incidents that occurred on the campuses of [[K-12]] [[State school|public schools]] and [[private school]]s as well as [[college]]s and [[universities]]. It excludes incidents that occurred during [[List of conflicts in the United States|wars]] or [[List of killings by law enforcement officers in the United States|police actions]] as well as [[murder-suicide]]s by rejected suitors or estranged spouses and [[List of suicides that have been attributed to bullying|suicides]] or [[suicide attempt]]s involving only one person. Mass shootings by staff of schools that involve only other employees are covered at [[List of rampage killers (workplace killings)#Disgruntled workers|workplace killings]]. This list does not include bombings such as the [[Bath School disaster]].

|[[Enoch Brown school massacre]]: Perhaps the earliest shooting to happen on school or college property, in what would become the [[United States]], was the notorious Enoch Brown school massacre during the [[Pontiac's War]]. Four Delaware (Lenape) American Indians entered the schoolhouse near present-day [[Greencastle, Pennsylvania|Greencastle]], Pennsylvania, and shot and killed schoolmaster Enoch Brown and nine children (reports vary). Only two children survived. However, this incident may only incidentally be considered a school "shooting" because only the teacher was shot, while the other nine victims were killed with [[melee weapons]]. {{sfn|Middleton|2007|p=171}}{{sfn|Dixon|2005|p=223}}

|[[South Pasadena High School#History|South Pasadena Junior High School murders]]: Outraged by his dismissal, following conflicts with other staff, thirty-eight-year-old Verlin H. Spencer shot and killed 62-year-old [[Superintendent (education)|superintendent]] of the [[South Pasadena, California|South Pasadena]] city schools George C. Bush, 50-year-old principal of [[South Pasadena High School]] John E. Alman, and 52-year-old School District business manager Will R. Speer. He then attempted to kill Bush's secretary, 32-year-old Dorothea Talbert; she was struck near the shoulder. He later shot and killed 45-year-old art teacher Ruth Sturgeon, with whom he'd been in conflict, fatally wounding her in the chest and, following an intense struggle, 35-year-old mechanical arts teacher Verner V. Vanderlip, another with whom he had a grievance. Spencer was cornered by police as he attempted to escape through the school cafeteria; as one officer aimed, Spencer pressed the .22 caliber automatic pistol against his right side and fired twice, critically wounding himself. Police later found a suicide note from Spencer to his wife, Polly. He survived his wounds and was tried for murder. Pleading guilty to all charges, he received 5 consecutive life terms. He was discharged from [[California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation|California's Department of Correction]] in 1977, aged 75. Verlin Spencer died January 11, 1991.<ref>{{cite news |url = http://articles.latimes.com/1997/jul/20/local/me-14688 |title = A Principal's Bloody Rampage |work = [[Los Angeles Times]] (Los Angeles, California) |date = July 20, 1997 |author = Cecilia Rasmussen |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121023112324/http://articles.latimes.com/1997/jul/20/local/me-14688 |archivedate = October 23, 2012 |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/thedailymirror/2010/05/jimmie-fidler-in-hollywood-may-7-1940.html |title = Jimmie Fidler in Hollywood, May 7, 1940 |work = [[Los Angeles Times]] The Daily Mirror (Los Angeles, California) |date = May 7, 2010 |author = Cecilia Rasmussen |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160423144103/http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/thedailymirror/2010/05/jimmie-fidler-in-hollywood-may-7-1940.html |archivedate = April 23, 2016 |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = http://projects.scpr.org/maps/pasadena-high-school-shooting-1940/ |title = Timeline: 1940 South Pasadena Shooting |work = [[KPCC]]'s databases (Pasadena, California) |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20160913222726/http://projects.scpr.org/maps/pasadena-high-school-shooting-1940/ |archivedate = September 13, 2016 |df = mdy-all }}</ref>{{sfn|Nash|1992|p=534}}
